2. Hands control over the professional activity to amateurs
who may turn out to be another NET Board, inaccessible
and immune to advice or petition.
3. Surrender of independence may be too high a price for
possible security and support.
4. Dilution of the NAEB into a broader enterprise whose
thrust will be TV station oriented and dominated.
5. After merging as a part of response to a temporary
political situation, the circumstances dictating this
course might recede; meanwhile, we have destroyed an
enduring institution and have no base extant for
ready refuge.
6. The alleged benefits don't compensate for giving up our
own organization, made by, run by, owned by the
professionals and operated for their benefit and in the
interests of the whole field.
7. It just plain hurts like hell to dismantle what you've
spent so much of your life building.
